abstract.p: Correction of July 2 article on vote by General Assembly of Presbyterian Church to amend church constitution to bar ministers from officiating at same-sex marriages

block.p: An article in some copies on July 2 about a vote by the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) in favor of an amendment to the church constitution to bar ministers from officiating at same-sex unions misstated the purpose of an amendment ratified by the church in 1997. The 1997 amendment prohibits the ordination of anyone who is sexually active outside marriage, not just noncelibate gays and lesbians.
